Key Match Events: West Indies survived a late scare to beat India by two wickets with seven balls remaining in their second Twenty20 cricket international on Sunday.
Chasing a target of 153, West Indies dropped from 126-4 to 129-8.
Nicholas Pooran hit 67 runs in 40 balls.
Akeal Hosein (16 not out) and Alzarri Joseph (10 not out) shared an unbroken 26-run stand to take West Indies to 155-8 in 18.5 overs.
Hardik Pandya was Indiaâ€™s most successful bowler with 3-35 in four overs.
Tilak Varma top-scored for India with a 41-ball 51.
Pre-Game Insights: India made one change with Ravi Bishnoi replacing injured Kuldeep Yadav.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams will stay in Providence, Guyana, for the third T20 on Tuesday, with the final two matches set for Lauderhill, Florida, on Aug. 12 and 13.
